title: Achievement Unlocked!
author: VD

After beating up on both politicized literary pretenders and McCreepy, the Master Monster Hunter is temporarily even more hated in SFWA circles than Orson Scott Card and me combined. He responded to Jim â€œMcCreepyâ€ Hines:

This is gonna be a long one.

Not really. He mostly hits and runs and does some check listing. Iâ€™m the long winded one.

The backstory: Author Alex Dally MacFarlane wrote an article called Post-Binary Gender in SF: An Introduction over at Tor.com, calling for â€œan end to the default of binary gender in science fiction stories.â€

One week later, author Larry Correia wrote a response to MacFarlaneâ€™s piece, called Ending Binary Gender in Fiction, or How to Murder Your Writing Career. (Side note: youâ€™ll probably want to avoid the comments on that one.)

That last part is very interesting. Youâ€™ll probably want to avoid the commentsâ€¦ Why? Because I donâ€™t edit them in anyway or â€œmassageâ€ them? Between the blog post and the corresponding Facebook post, Iâ€™ve got a few hundred comments. Of those, there are a handful that are very mean (this is the internet) but most of them are reasonable, and interestingly enough Iâ€™ve also got homosexuals and transsexuals who posted in the comments who thought the original Tor blog post was as ham fisted as I did.

I tried to ignore it. Thereâ€™s no way Iâ€™m going to change Correiaâ€™s mind about this stuff, any more than his post changed my thinking. But of course, there are a lot of other people lurking and participating in the conversation,

and while I know this is going to do bad things to my blood pressure, I think itâ€™s a conversation worth having.

Hehâ€¦ My blood pressure is fine. Arguing with lefties on the internet is what I do to relax. In my last fisk, I talked about how the blog post was angsty emo bullshit.

I wrote lots of words, ergo, thatâ€™s angstyâ€¦ Or it could just be that Iâ€™m a WRITER who averages 3k of paying fiction a day, I threw that thing together while I was waiting for the matinee of I Frankenstein to start. Considering half of those words were a cut and paste of the original Tor articleâ€¦ Manâ€¦ That means Jim Hines just wrote SIX THOUSAND WORDS to respond! Holy shit. Thatâ€™s hard core!

Thatâ€™s sort of the point.Â  I wrote my post for the aspiring authors who might read Tor.com and think that Ending Binary Gender in Sci-Fi was good advice. I pointed out that when you write with the goal of checking boxes to satisfy the cause of the day, your writing will probably suck.

I agree that if youâ€™re writing a story with the kind of checklist Correia describes, youâ€™re probably going to get a bad story.
